meanings.definition: To remove leaves from a plant or tree.
meanings.sent1: The gardener was defoliating the tree to help it grow better.
meanings.sent2: The strong wind was defoliating the trees in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought defoliating the tree was a fun game.
meanings.sent4: The caterpillars were defoliating the plants, leaving them bare and vulnerable.
meanings.sent5: The act of defoliating can sometimes be necessary for the health of the plants.

meanings.definition: Causing the leaves to fall off a plant or tree.
meanings.sent1: The defoliating storm left the trees looking bare and sad.
meanings.sent2: The defoliating effects of the harsh winter were evident on the landscape.
meanings.sent3: The defoliating power of the leaf blower amazed the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: The defoliating season brought a sense of change and renewal to the forest.
meanings.sent5: The defoliating process is a natural part of the tree's life cycle.
